item.title: 2019 Australian Fires
item.description:
During the end of 2019, wildfires proliferated across Australia. As part of the R For Data Science TidyTuesday series, I analyzed Australian temperature and rainfall data to attempt to discern potential contributers to the historic and devastating 2019 Australia bush fires. The visualizations below were created using R. All code can be found on github here.

Fire Locations

Are Temperatures Increasing?

A quick analysis shows that average annual temperatures have increased in almost all cities over the past 75 years.

Less Rainfall?

The data also shows a trend for decreasing amounts of rainfall.

item.title: NYC Squirrels
item.description:
As part of the R For Data Science TidyTuesday series, I analyzed data from the first annual Central Park Squirrel Census. The 2018 survey identified over 2,000 individual squirrels in New York City’s Central Park and documented detailed individual characteristics such as location, age, color & behavior. All code can be found on github here.

Where are the most squirrels in Central Park?

What are other characteristics of Central Park squirrels?

item.title: Ornithology
item.description: Using the eBird app, I record observations of the birds I identify while traveling and around my home. I created a workflow for obtaining and wrangling my eBird database with ‘google sheets’ and ‘dplyr’, as well as a visualization of my bird observations using ‘Rmarkdown’ with additional usage of ‘leaflet’ and ‘datatable’. The result is a quick and easy way to track and understand the various birds that I have observed over time.

item.title: Ski
item.description: Information about snowpack and weather conditions is important for safe and enjoyable experiences skiing in the backcountry. I track my ski tours using GAIA GPS and record information on each tour, such as elevation gain, weather, and other observations. This rmarkdown webapp displays some of the backcountry ski tours I’ve taken over the last few years, including a custom basemap I created using Mapbox.
